questions.question: What is the primary purpose of use-case modeling?
options: To design the system's database structure
To capture and communicate functional requirements from a user's perspective
To write the program code for the system
To test the system after implementation
questions.correctAnswerText: To capture and communicate functional requirements from a user's perspective

questions.question: Who or what is considered an 'actor' in use-case modeling?
options: Only human users
Only external systems
Anyone or anything that interacts with the system to exchange information
Only the system itself
questions.correctAnswerText: Anyone or anything that interacts with the system to exchange information

questions.question: What does a use-case narrative describe?
options: The system's hardware requirements
The business event and how the user interacts with the system to complete a task
The cost of system development
The system's programming language
questions.correctAnswerText: The business event and how the user interacts with the system to complete a task

questions.question: What is an 'extends' relationship in use-case modeling?
options: A relationship where one use case depends on another
A relationship where two use cases are identical
A relationship where an extension use case adds steps to another use case
A relationship between two actors
questions.correctAnswerText: A relationship where an extension use case adds steps to another use case

questions.question: What is the first step in the process of use-case modeling?
options: Document use-case narratives
Draw use-case diagrams
Identify business actors
Rank use cases by priority

questions.question: What is a 'temporal event' in use-case modeling?
options: An event triggered by a user
An event triggered by time
An event triggered by another system
An event triggered by data input

questions.question: What is the purpose of a use-case dependency diagram?
options: To show the system's hardware architecture
To list all actors in the system
To depict dependencies among use cases and aid in project planning
To design the user interface
questions.correctAnswerText: To depict dependencies among use cases and aid in project planning

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of use-case modeling?
options: It writes the code automatically
It replaces the need for testing
It designs the database tables
It helps decompose the system into manageable pieces
questions.correctAnswerText: It helps decompose the system into manageable pieces

questions.question: What is an 'abstract use case'?
options: A use case that combines common steps from multiple use cases to reduce redundancy
A use case with no actors
A use case that cannot be implemented
A use case that only system admins can access
questions.correctAnswerText: A use case that combines common steps from multiple use cases to reduce redundancy

questions.question: In use-case modeling, what does the 'depends on' relationship indicate?
options: One actor inherits from another
One use case must be performed before another
One use case is optional
One actor can replace another
questions.correctAnswerText: One use case must be performed before another
